thread.title: ACB files charge sheet in Delhi transport scam
thread.title_full: ACB files charge sheet in Delhi transport scam

author: IANS
title: ACB files charge sheet in Delhi transport scam
text: Moneylife Â» ACB files charge sheet in Delhi transport scam 43297 ACB files charge sheet in Delhi transport scam 0 Comments, Be the first to comment + COMMENT IANS | 04/09/2015 02:30 PM | The Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) of Delhi government on Thursday filed a charge sheet in Rs.100 crore transport scam that allegedly took place during the previous Sheila Dikshit dispensation. The ACB filed the charge sheet before Special Judge Poonam Chaudhry. In 2012, the ACB had registered a case in the alleged loss of Rs.100 crore to the Delhi government in awarding the contract of operation and maintenance of inspection and certification of CNG vehicles. The first information report was lodged on a court's order after a complaint case was filed by RTI activist Vivek Garg, who has alleged that then transport commissioner R.K. Verma with others has conspired to favour a private company, ESP India, in a contract, causing losses to the public exchequer. The contract was awarded to ESP India in 2002. According to Garg, in 2013, ACB has arrested several of the accused but later they were granted bail after probe agency failed to file a charge sheet in the case. More in Moneylife
